freenet.client.async
Class ClientRequester

java.lang.Object
  freenet.client.async.ClientRequester
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaseClientGetter, BaseClientPutter
public abstract class ClientRequester
extends Object

A high level client request. A request (either fetch or put) started by a Client. Has a suitable context and a URI; is fulfilled only when we have followed all the redirects etc, or have an error. Can be retried.

Field Summary

          Has totalBlocks stopped growing?
protected  boolean cancelled
          Has the request or insert been cancelled?

          Minimum number of blocks required to succeed for success.

protected  SendableRequestSet requests
          The set of queued low-level requests or inserts for this request or insert.
protected  boolean sentToNetwork
          Has at least one block been scheduled to be sent to the network? Requests can be satisfied entirely from the datastore sometimes.
protected  int successfulBlocks
          Number of blocks we have successfully completed a fetch/put for.
protected  int totalBlocks
          Total number of blocks this request has tried to fetch/put.

                                  ClientGetState newState,

getPriorityClass

public short getPriorityClass()
What is our priority class?

cancel

protected boolean cancel()
Cancel the request. Inner method, subclasses should actually tell the ClientGetState or whatever to cancel itself: this does not do anything apart from set a flag!

Returns:
Whether we were already cancelled.

cancel

public abstract void cancel(com.db4o.ObjectContainer container,
                            ClientContext context)
Cancel the request. Subclasses must implement to actually tell the ClientGetState's or ClientPutState's to cancel.

Parameters:
container - The database. Must be non-null if the request or insert is persistent, in which case we must be on the database thread.
context - The ClientContext object including essential but non-persistent objects such as the schedulers.

isCancelled

public boolean isCancelled()
Is the request or insert cancelled?

getURI

public abstract FreenetURI getURI()
Get the URI for the request or insert. For a request this is set at creation, but for an insert, it is set when we know what the final URI will be.

isFinished

public abstract boolean isFinished()
Is the request or insert completed (succeeded, failed, or cancelled, which is a kind of failure)?

hashCode

public int hashCode()
We need a hash code that persists across restarts.

Overrides:
hashCode in class Object

blockSetFinalized

public void blockSetFinalized(com.db4o.ObjectContainer container,
                              ClientContext context)
The set of blocks has been finalised, total will not change any more. Notify clients.

Parameters:
container - The database. Must be non-null if the request or insert is persistent, in which case we must be on the database thread.
context - The ClientContext object including essential but non-persistent objects such as the schedulers.

We completed a block. Count it and notify clients unless dontNotify.

toNetwork

public void toNetwork(com.db4o.ObjectContainer container,
                      ClientContext context)
Called when we first send a request to the network. Ensures that it really is the first time and passes on to innerToNetwork().

innerToNetwork

protected abstract void innerToNetwork(com.db4o.ObjectContainer container,
                                       ClientContext context)
Notify clients that a request has gone to the network, for the first time, i.e. we have finished checking the datastore for at least one part of the request.

getClient

public RequestClient getClient()
Get client context object

setPriorityClass

public void setPriorityClass(short newPriorityClass,
                             ClientContext ctx,
                             com.db4o.ObjectContainer container)
Change the priority class of the request (request includes inserts here).

Parameters:
newPriorityClass - The new priority class for the request or insert.
ctx - The ClientContext, contains essential transient objects such as the schedulers.
container - The database. If the request is persistent, this must be non-null, and we must be running on the database thread; you should schedule a job using the DBJobRunner.

public boolean persistent()
Is this request persistent?

getSendableRequests

public SendableRequest[] getSendableRequests(com.db4o.ObjectContainer container)
Get all known low-level requests belonging to this high-level request.

Parameters:
container - The database, must be non-null if this is a persistent request or persistent insert.
